comment.body: @Geekless: You can reach the ipv6 internet by signing up for a free tunnel using hurricane electric's tunnel broker. Or you can join cjdns, an alternative network based on ipv6 and with strong crypto and designed for mesh networks (but also works over the regular internet)
@Kaffie: I don't know how to do that but if you link me to the appropriate documentation pages I can try.
@Kaffie: I guess something like ZeroMail is more appropriate for this discussion?
I set up a bootstrap node over cjdns, can anyone check it works? `zero://fc18:e736:105d:d49a:2ab5:14a2:698f:7021:15441`
@Kaffie: Awesome! I'll try to keep it up as much as possible.

@Kaffie: Well there are quite a few public peers already listed on https://github.com/hyperboria/peers, it's a good start as long as the zeronet traffic doesn't use up all their bandwith. If that happens we can ask people to set up more public peers.
